org.trimou.engine.resolver

Interface EnhancedResolver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConfigurationAware, Resolver, WithPriority
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractResolver, ArrayIndexResolver, CombinedIndexResolver, DateTimeFormatResolver, DummyTransformResolver, IndexResolver, ListIndexResolver, LocaleAwareResolver, MapCustomKeyResolver, MapResolver, NumberFormatResolver, ReflectionResolver, ResourceBundleResolver, ThisResolver, TransformResolver

    public interface EnhancedResolver
extends Resolver
    An enhanced resolver should be able to create a EnhancedResolver.Hint for a sucessfully resolved context object and name.

    Note that hints may not always give better results. E.g. if we have a tag {{foo.bar}} and first we pass data where foo is resolved as a map and then another data where foo is resolved as an integer, the hint created for the map will not work for integer. In this case, the hint should inform that it's not applicable and the resolver chain will be used to resolve the value.

    EngineConfigurationKey.RESOLVER_HINTS_ENABLED can be used to disable the hints entirely.

    Author:
    Martin Kouba
    See Also:
    EngineConfigurationKey.RESOLVER_HINTS_ENABLED

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  EnhancedResolver.Hint
      A hint could be used to skip the resolver chain for a part of the key of a specific tag.

    • Method Detail

      • createHint

        EnhancedResolver.Hint createHint(Object contextObject,
                                 String name,
                                 ResolutionContext context)
        This method may only be called right after the Resolver.resolve(Object, String, ResolutionContext) of the same resolver returns a non-null value. The parameters must be the same.

        The created hint is currently only used to skip the resolver chain for the first part of a key of a variable tag, i.e. foo for {{foo}} or {{foo.bar}}.

        This method must not return null.

        Parameters:
        contextObject -
        name -
        context -
        Returns:
        the hint
        See Also:
        Hints.INAPPLICABLE_HINT
